xxl.core.relational.cursors
Class SortBasedIntersection

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<E>
      xxl.core.cursors.intersections.SortBasedIntersection<Tuple>
          xxl.core.relational.cursors.SortBasedIntersection
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterator<Tuple>, Cursor<Tuple>, MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
public class SortBasedIntersection
extends SortBasedIntersection<Tuple>
implements MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>

An operator that computes an intersection using the sort-merge paradigm. The input iterations have to be sorted according to the comparator that is turned over.

          The metadata provided by the sort-based intersection.

Field Detail

globalMetaData

protected CompositeMetaData<Object,Object> globalMetaData
The metadata provided by the sort-based intersection.

Constructor Detail

SortBasedIntersection

public SortBasedIntersection(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> sortedCursor0,
                             MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> sortedCursor1,
                             SweepAreaImplementor<Tuple> impl,
                             Comparator<? super Tuple> comparator)
Creates a new sort-based intersection operator backed on two sorted input iterations using the given sweep-area to store the elements of the first input iteration and probe with the elements of the second one for matchings.

Parameters:
sortedCursor0 - the first sorted metadata cursor to be intersected.
sortedCursor1 - the second sorted metadata cursor to be intersected.
impl - the sweep-area implementor used for storing elements of the first sorted input iteration (sortedInput0).
comparator - the comparator that is used for comparing elements of the two sorted input iterations.

SortBasedIntersection

public SortBasedIntersection(ResultSet sortedResultSet0,
                             ResultSet sortedResultSet1,
                             SweepAreaImplementor<Tuple> impl,
                             Comparator<? super Tuple> comparator)
Creates a new sort-based intersection operator backed on two sorted input result sets using the given sweep-area to store the elements of the first input result set and probe with the elements of the second one for matchings.

Parameters:
sortedResultSet0 - the first sorted result set to be intersected.
sortedResultSet1 - the second sorted result set to be intersected.
impl - the sweep-area implementor used for storing elements of the first sorted input result set (sortedInput0).
comparator - the comparator that is used for comparing elements of the two sorted input result set.
